CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 20, 1973, pg. 27, reads: "Champs Of Yester Years: The Original Crawfords! - in photo above are the original Crawfords baseball club. The photo was taken in 1926; and according to one member, Teenie Harris (seated second from right), who happens to be the Courier Staff Photographer, says that they were 'great!' Weelll, we know how Teenie can stretch-the-blanket at times; but in this case he wasn't.  Others have told us that the Crawfords, had they been playing in the majors today, could 'whup'em all!'  Meet the champs of yester years (standing from l. to r.): Nate, Bill Harris, Harry Deal [sic], Buster Christian, and Jasper Stevens; (sitting from l. to r.): William Smith, Tootsie Deal, Julius, Whitey Turner, Reece Mosby [Reese Mosley], Bill Jones, Teenie Harris and Johnny Moore."
TitMainTitle: Copy of a photograph of 1926 Pittsburgh Crawfords baseball team, standing left to right: Nate, co-founder Bill Harris, Harry Beale, Buster Christian, and Jasper Stevens; seated left to right: William Smith, Tootsie Deal, Julius, Whitey Turner, Reese Mosley, Bill Jones, co-founder Charles "Teenie" Harris, and Johnny Moore
